main event: A brilliant flash of light, like an explosion, was seen in the sky over Osceola, Wisconsin at 1619 hours on 7 July 1952, along with the observation of two unidentified objects.
interesting points: The flash was described as very bright and visible for about 2 to 3 seconds., The objects were circular in shape and made abrupt changes in direction and speed., The sighting was reported by several witnesses including Mrs. Osceola and four children., An Air Force investigation was conducted, and the incident was reported as 'Unidentified'., The objects were reported to emit a bright light and hovered for approximately 10 minutes.
sighted object: Two unidentified circular objects and a brilliant flash of light
witness description: Mrs. Osceola and four children, as well as a truck driver and several other civilians
